newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-Indian GDRs lag Bombay rally.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-Indian GDRs lag Bombay rally.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts posted gains in light London trade but lacked follow-through support after Bombay stocks rallied earlier, traders said.
"The market was very quiet and never really reflected local market strength," a trader said.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed up 0.62 points at 69.56, with the premium over the local market at 11.73 percent, well down on Friday's 14.94 percent.

The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index closed 3.7 percent higher at 3,562.74 after stocks rallied on rising hopes of the government unveiling a policy package to stimulate markets and encourage investment.
Indian Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda said earlier that new economic policy measures would be announced this week.
A trader said the Indian GDRs had some room to climb if current strength in the local market continued.
"But most do not trust the run," he said.
State Bank of India and Reliance attracted early interest in otherwise light volumes. SBI GDRs added 31 cents to $19.63/$20.13 and Reliance rose 42 cents to $14.00/$15.00.
The Capel Korea GDR Index ended 1.76 points down at 64.73, a premium of 53.05 percent over the local market after the Korea Composite index shed 2.98 percent to a provisional 664.70.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended 1.77 points lower at 98.83, a premium of 5.72 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index lost 55.32 points or 0.77 percent to finish at 7,156.96.
